FuncDef:
The active delay-time command configures a time period during which an AC interface remains in the blocked state.
The undo active delay-time command restores the default time period during which an AC interface remains in the blocked state.
By default, AC interfaces remain in the blocked state for 30s.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a time period during which an AC interface remains in the blocked state.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 256, in seconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In VPLS multi-homing scenarios, if networks are unstable, AC interfaces may frequently flap, causing frequent PW switching. To prevent this problem, run the active delay-time command to configure a time period during which an AC interface remains in the blocked state. Before delay-time elapses, the AC interface remains in the Down state. After delay-time elapses, the AC interface goes Up. This reduces PW switching frequency.
Prerequisites
A multi-homing site ID has been configured using the site-id site-id command.
